{"step_by_step_thinking": "Subcortical dementia is a type of dementia that results from dysfunction in the parts of the brain that are beneath the cortex. Parkinson's disease, supranuclear palsy, and HIV associated dementia are all conditions that can cause subcortical dementia. Alzheimer's disease, on the other hand, is a type of cortical dementia, which is caused by problems in the cerebral cortex, the outer layer of the brain.", "answer_choice": "A"}
